item.description:
Experience hiking with one of the easiest 4000 Ft White Mountain hikes.
Read up on what to wear, and what to pack.. Proper clothing, headlamps and footwear are standard equipment on all hikes.



Mt. Waumbek is reached by the Starr King trail (rt: 7.2 miles, 2,650 feet, 4:55 hour book time) with easy grades and good footing. It passes over Starr King, which has good views of the Presidential range, there are no views from the summit of Waumbek itself.

Profile
Mt. Waumbek (4,006 ft.), is the highest peak in the Pliny Range of New Hampshire's North Country, offering views to the east from the summit.



Moderate rating for fit hikers: The trip to Waumbek is coupled with an ascent of neighboring Mt. Starr King. Hikers ascend Starr King via the Starr King Trail and continue on past the summit to Waumbek's summit, 1 mile to the east.
The summit marks the southern end of the Kilkenny Ridge Trail, which continues on to Mt. Weeks, Terrace Mountain and Mt. Cabot.



Where:Starr King Trailhead, Jefferson , NH 03583

Trailhead: The trail starts on side road off the north side of Rt 2, 0.2 miles east of Rt 115 jct. There is a country store there with the last available restroom and food.

The parking lot is behind a small residential area, drive up the hill, past the houses until you see the sign identifying the parking lot. (Lat:44.25182 Lon:-71.2791)


The group can stop for after hike festivities in Woodstock or Lincoln.
item.how_to_find_us: Say hello at the trailhead and mention your with Meetup.
item.name: Mt. Waumbek via Starr King Trail
